title: Is Invictus Gaming really a Chinese team?
body: I don't follow pro players or the pro scene much at all, but I've watched replays of games on the Korean server(s), and I know I've seen The Shy in at least a few games. If you go on lol.gamepedia.com you'll notice almost half of their active roster is Korean players. Is this really a win for China when almost half of their team is from a different country? Just saying. I'm not butthurt that Fanatic lost or anything (personally I don't really care who wins), and I'm happy for IG, but I don't really think it's fair to call Invictus Gaming a Chinese team when almost half of their players are Korean. As a comparison, look at Fanatic. Almost their entire team is European players, so it's completely fair to call them an EU team.

IG is registered and presented as a Chinese team. The team's nationality is Chinese regardless of who goes into the team. 

The same reason why say, Fnatic having had many Korean players in its roster at different part of its history (former and current; 1 currently active) does not in any way undermine the unquestionable fact that it's an European team; or how the 2 currently active EU players in C9 also does not in any way, shape, or form undermine C9 as a NA team.

League (and most sport and game topic/event) is not something like Olympic Games or World Cup where BOTH the team and the player themselves represent the nation/region they are from, it does not require specific citizenship of the player to be recognised eligible to join and represent a team. In League, the victory is in the end of the day crowned to the team and not the nation/region; the tendency to associate teams with nationalities is ultimately unofficial and only exist mainly within the playerbase. This is the same for every single team sport and game event that is not specific and emphasising on the nationality part, which is basically 90%+ of it; import happens a lot  and this is no news, so to speak.

Either way, the team is a Chinese team because it's registered as Chinese, and that's kinda it. It's that easy.
